Ok, this is basically like an "addition" to Counter-Strike 1.6. Except, this game includes a campaign...sure, it plays just like multiplayer, but at the same time, CZ introduced to us the Counter-Strike bot! I don't really mind that the campaign is absolute rubbis, if you don't want to pay extra for Source, then get this, because it does also include the CS 1.6, and some deleted scenes that were considered for campaign, which I thought were much better than the campaign itself...anyway, that's my review, a solid 8.

Condition Zero ist trotz seines Alters, immer noch ein anspruchsvolles, sowie spaßiges Spiel.

Of course, everyone knows Counter Strike is an excellent FPS. Condition Zero is essentially a beefed up CS 1.6 with a objective-oriented single player campaign, nicer and newer textures, and the ability to pick up dropped grenades. If you haven't already been entrenched in 1.6, I recommend giving CZ a try.
Ultimately though, CS:GO is the defacto game at the moment. If you want competetive gaming with an active community, that is your best bet.

I don't usually enjoy playing the earlier versions of games such as this, but this particular game and Counterstrike 1.6 are exceptions. Surprisingly, they're still very fun to play despite the outdated graphics because the great gameplay that all Counterstrike games provide is there. What's even better is the lack of lag, which makes for less frustrating times. I especially like the tactical shield and the old knife animations. ;)
Know when you ask for it, and when it happens, you really regret it? Yeah.

There are thousands of better multi-player shooter games out there. For some inexplicable reason Counter Strike (in all it's shitty glory) seems to have attracted and sustained the largest fan-base. Overall there is nothing remarkable about this title, but ask another ten or twenty people and you'll likely find a lot of positive opinions.

I originally made this review for Condition-Zero: Deleted Scenes because I liked some of the campaign missions. That still holds. It's nothing story-based, it's just you as a CTU doing CT things 
like:
-Rescuing Hostages
-Killing the bad people
-Stopping the bad people from doing bad things
-Bhopping through levels
-Holding truckloads of weapons in your back-pocket

It's alright, nothing to rave about when it comes to a literal console port

Agreable donc pour connaitre le jeu en s'amusant tranquillement.

For such an old game, I found alot of enjoyment for this. Theres lasers, bank robberies, puzzles, stealth missions, hostage rescues, not noob friendly.

Pros: Great Gameplay.
Fun Stealth Missions
Not nooby friendly.
Puzzles
Shootable Vents
Fiberwire (Add's alot to gameplay and stealth missions)
Incorporated real world possibilities, you can shoot a guard without alerting others cause the bank vault is soundproof.
Lots of audio lines.


Cons: You cannot drop your weapon.
You find yourself using your knife lots of the time since you can't pick up enemies guns. Gotta be one of the biggest cons.
It's autosave feature overwrites good save spots with instant death save spots, like autosaving when your about to be shot or activate lasers.
Hostages stop following you on the easiest of turns.
You turn a corner and a hostage says they can't go sorry.
The AI coop missions are horrible because your friendly AI rushes out in the open and dies. So you have to solo it then move your Friendly AI

Counter-Strike: Condition Zero is a revamped version of the original Counter-Strike with new maps, new graphics, new weapons and interface improvements. It also includes a single-player mode with difficulty levels and bots you can swap out as you progress through the 'tour of duty'. It's fun on Normal difficulty and below, but on Hard and above you need to be good at CS to really make progress. There's also custom campaigns available online.

The 'Deleted Scenes' are a series of single-player missions. Unlike the regular CZ, these are scripted, generally linear/cinematic in nature and put you in a wider variety of unconnected situations including bank robberies and drug busts. Some of the missions are great, some of them are average; sometimes it can get quite campy as evidenced by my original 'review' above, and there are only a handful of custom missions I found online. Almost none of them really go into the backstory of the terrorism and assorted nefarious acts on display here: you're just the tip of the spear meant to counter terrorist aggression.

The development of this game is rather storied, with four separate companies working on it before its release. It was intended to be a revamp of the original CS with a single-player mode, then it was turned into a game with single-player missions (the Deleted Scenes(. Then it was restarted again in the vein of the first version, which shipped with the missions anyway. For more details, you can read [url=http://counterstrike.wikia.com/wiki/Development_of_Counter-Strike:_Condition_Zero]this[/url].

If you're a fan of classic CS and feel like something different, I'd say give it a shot. I'm not sure if it'll do anything for you unless you're a CS/oldschool shooter fan, but since it's an old CS game there's still plenty of people playing it online.
Worth getting if you like counter-strike, it comes with CS 1.6 and Condition Zero, and also has a single player mode in the deleted scenes.

Counter-Strike: Condition Zero довольная не плохая альтернатива обычной Counter-Strike. Не много обновленный движок игры, новые текстуры и модели. Пристуствие сюжета (Deleted Scenes) и мини-миссий. Не столь популярен как Counter-Strike, но этим компенсирует почти полное отсутствие читеров на серверах. Входит в комплект Counter-Strike: Antalogy.

When I saw this game came with "CZ: Deleted Scenes", I assumed it would be a neat little addon that I might spend 10 minutes watching. It is exactly the opposite. "Deleted Scenes" is more fun than the game itself. It's a fully-playable Counter-Strike mission-based adventure. It's almost like the CoD of Counter-Strike! I love it, and if you like the original Counter-Strike, I guarantee you will too.
